page.title: 01Larriston Fell & Bloody Bush
page.content: The area covered by this D-Block straddles the border between England and Scotland,and is made up of open moorland and forest.{Larriston Fells,} reaching a height of 512 metres above sea-level, form the natural border, whilst the administrative boundary is to the east and slightly lower. On the Scottish side the fell slopes steeply towards{Larriston Rigg}and is drained by a series of{burns} and{ {sikes}. The gentler slopes to the east are covered by the{Kielder Forest.} Cattle graze on the open moorland, which is crossed by a track which once carried the cross-border traffic. At {Bloody Bush}a large stone pillar records the tolls charged for the passage of various livestock, as well as distances to various locations. There are no settlements in the area.
